urls.title: Rare species threatened by sewage in waterways
urls.description: The Environment Agency is failing to meet the terms of a court order which demanded that it act to protect dozens of protected waterways from agricultural sewage, placing some of the country‚Äôs most

tweets.text:
The destruction of England's waterways - by over extracting water and routinely dumping raw sewage - and the @EnvAgency's complicity in it is one of the great untold scandals.

We at @GoodLawProject are putting together a formidable team to take this on.
https://t.co/Q4gCrffC2j
Before and after pics. Our field team has been working in the Alcester area #Warwickshire to prevent blockages by clearing a fallen tree from the River Arrow #flood #teamEA https://t.co/hq5myIBzyW

Not long ago these fish came on a not irregular basis up into British waters. Did they recall dimly a time when their ancestors unimpeded spawned in great shoals in gravel beds of crystal clear flows ? We‚Äôre they surplus from other lands where life was still tenable ? Gone now. https://t.co/Li2VSERykc

@RachSalv @JamesBevanEA @EmmaEHoward @pow_rebecca @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency Will be shouting into the void at a village hall meeting tonight on @RiverChess sewage discharges. The @EnvAgency  have sent a briefing paper on sewage discharges that is so wrong and misleading it is almost criminal, correct they will not be attending. @thameswater will be there

tweets.text: @Feargal_Sharkey @GeorgeTrefgarne @EnvAgency I almost think they miss the targets on purpose and blame lack of funding. Like let's set our targets way high, then when we fail we can blame the big bad Tories.

A compelling and devastating round-up of the calamity facing England's rivers and the "Hotbed of mediocrity", that is the @EnvAgency.

Great stuff by @RachSalv https://t.co/d01T1Ts2Ft

Simple enough. Sign a petition to stop untreated sewage being dumped in our rivers and seas by the water industry. Hey  @wateruk members;  try actually doing what you say you do in your propaganda. Please RT and get your friends to SIGN! https://t.co/LBjhrPQIJl

tweets.text:
Good old @EnvAgency does it again. Missed its own performance target by nearly 25%.

Aim for 2019 - 20, "Enhance", 2,300 kilometres of rivers, lakes and coastal waters.

Result? Fail!

Question. What exactly do you mean by "enhanced"? How is that defined, who makes that decision? https://t.co/9x3KDtkqDj

@RachSalv @GeorgeMonbiot @JamesBevanEA @EmmaEHoward @pow_rebecca @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency Well done, @RachSalv it's so heartbreaking to see our rivers in steep decline while governments hide behind the curtains. Have you seen the annual report from the @EnvAgency yet?

tweets.text:
Our ports could be hiding #WasteCrime activity. 
 
Waste criminals try to profit from selling and exporting waste abroad, leaving it for someone else to deal with and potentially harming the environment. 
 
Our port officers work to stop this waste from travelling abroad üëá https://t.co/vgNsZEAPtV
